label.value: [color=dim]Briefly increase your lateral movement speed for quicker travel and easier enemy evasion.[/color]

[color=special]Sprint[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level:[/color] 3
Sprint briefly increases your [color=dim]lateral movement speed[/color], allowing for quicker travel and easier enemy evasion.
Higher levels of [color=dim]Sprint[/color] offer small [color=dim]speed increases[/color] while incrementally decreasing the base [color=dim]recharge time[/color].

[color=special]Sprint[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level:[/color] 5
The first upgrade to Sprint increases the [color=dim]rate[/color] and [color=dim]duration[/color] of your sprint by a small amount.
It also reduces the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by 1 second.

[color=special]Sprint[/color]
Sprint briefly increases your [color=dim]lateral movement[/color], allowing for quicker travel and easier enemy evasion.
[color=dim]Level 1:[/color] Run slightly faster.
[color=dim]Level 2:[/color] Run a bit faster.
[color=dim]Level 3:[/color] Run very fast!

[color=special]Sprint[/color]
Sprint briefly increases your [color=dim]lateral movement[/color], allowing for quicker travel and easier enemy evasion.
[color=dim]Level 1:[/color] Run slightly faster.
[color=dim]Level 2:[/color] Run a bit faster.
[color=dim]Level 3:[/color] Run very fast!

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Sprint[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Matrix[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Sprint[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Matrix[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Sprint[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Matrix[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Sprint[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Movement[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Matrix[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level:[/color] 3
Matrix dramatically slows the movement speed of every [color=dim]enemy[/color] on the screen, allowing you time to [color=dim]escape[/color] looming posses or to complete advanced [color=dim]digging puzzles[/color].
Higher levels of [color=dim]Matrix[/color] improve the power of the effect (slowing enemies to a [color=dim]crawl[/color]) while slowly decreasing the skill's [color=dim]recharge time[/color].

[color=special]Matrix[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level:[/color] 3
This upgrade to the [color=dim]Matrix[/color] skill amplifies the power of the effect, slowing enemies' speed by an additional [color=dim]15%[/color].
Additionally, you will gain a small increase in the effect's [color=dim]duration[/color], plus an appreciable decrease in the overall [color=dim]recharge time[/color].

[color=special]Matrix[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level:[/color] 15
The final upgrade to the [color=dim]Matrix[/color] skill again enhances the effect's strength while offering small improvements to its [color=dim]duration[/color] and [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
Moreover, any enemy within a radius of 2 blocks will now [color=dim]freeze completely[/color] for 1 second.
Slow down objects and enemies in the world around you while you yourself move at full speed.
Slow down objects and enemies in the world around you while you yourself move at full speed.

prompt.alert:
The [color=special]Matrix[/color] skill will briefly slow down every object in the world around you; you alone will continue to move in [color=special]real-time[/color].
Future upgrades can increase the [color=special]power[/color] of the effect (slowing enemies to a crawl) and extend the [color=special]duration[/color] of the matrix effect.
[color=warning]Note:[/color] [color=dim]If you commit to Matrix, you will forfeit the ability to acquire the[/color] [color=evil]Sprint[/color] [color=dim]skill.[/color]
Are you sure?

label.value: You have already unlocked [color=dim]Sprint[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Matrix[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Sprint[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Persuasion[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Hacking[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Control[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Persuasion[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
As a passive skill, Persuasion [color=dim]automatically[/color] takes effect during [color=dim]dialogue sequences[/color], allowing you to exert an unusual amount of [color=dim]control[/color] over the people you talk to.
Further upgrades to the [color=dim]Persuasion[/color] skill can lower [color=dim]shoppe prices[/color] and increase your overall [color=dim]persuasiveness[/color].

[color=special]Persuasion[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
By upgrading your [color=dim]Persuasion[/color] skill to Level 2, you will receive a [color=dim]15% discount[/color] in all shoppes.
You will also obtain access to Level 2 Persuasion dialogue response options.
Next - Level 2 Highly Persuasive Shoppe Discount: 15%

[color=special]Persuasion[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The final upgrade to [color=dim]Persuasion[/color] doubles the discount you receive in shoppes to [color=dim]30%[/color].
At this level, you will have access to all dialogue options.
Current - Level 2 Highly Persuasive Shoppe Discount: 15%
Next - Level 3 Irresistibly Persuasive Shoppe Discount: 30%

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Persuasion[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Hacking[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Persuasion[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Persuasion[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Persuasion[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Hacking[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Persuasion[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Control[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Hacking[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The [color=dim]Hacking[/color] skill works passively, automatically revealing portions of terminal [color=dim]keycodes[/color] and unlocking advanced options when accessing [color=dim]terminals[/color].
Higher levels of this skill reveal [color=dim]longer portions[/color] of passcodes (revealing entire short codes and great portions of longer codes), occasionally yielding special [color=dim]experience bonuses[/color].
Next - Level 1 Reveal 2 Digits Access low-security options

[color=special]Hacking[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
At Level 2, the [color=dim]Hacking[/color] skill reveals an additional digit in each passcode.
You will also gain access to increasingly secure [color=dim]terminal options[/color].
Current - Level 1 Reveal 2 Digits Access low-security options
Next - Level 2 Reveal 3 Digits Access medium-security options

[color=special]Hacking[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The fully upgraded [color=dim]Hacking[/color] skill reveals [color=dim]5 digits[/color] of any code, oftentimes providing you the entire keycode in the process.
At this level, you will also have access to every [color=dim]secure terminal option[/color] you encounter.
Current - Level 2 Reveal 3 Digits Access medium-security options
Next - Level 3 Reveal 5 digits Access all secure options

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Hacking[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Persuasion[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Hacking[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Hacking[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Hacking[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Hologram[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Fright[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Deception[/color] skill tree.

#[color=special]Hologram[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Cast out a [color=dim]holographic decoy[/color] that looks just like you, stealing each enemy's attention for a moment.
When fully upgraded, the decoy will [color=dim]explode[/color] like a bomb upon expiration.

[color=special]Hologram[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The first upgrade to [color=dim]Hologram[/color] increases the lifespan of the [color=dim]decoy[/color] by an additional second.
It also drops the overall [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by [color=dim]10%[/color].

[color=special]Hologram[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Hologram's ultimate upgrade further increases the decoy's [color=dim]lifespan[/color] while once again decreasing the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by [color=dim]10%[/color].
More importantly, this upgrade causes the decoy to [color=dim]explode[/color] just like a bomb when its lifespan expires. This explosion [color=dim]can blow you up[/color] as well!
Next - Level 3 Duration: 5s Recharge: 25s Explodes after 5s

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Hologram[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Fright[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Hologram[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Hologram[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Hologram[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Fright[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Hologram[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Deception[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Fright[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
[color=dim]Fright[/color] allows you to cast a momentary sense of [color=dim]panic[/color] upon your foes. Each foe will flee your presence at any cost.
Future upgrades to this skill can increase the [color=dim]speed[/color] of each fleeing enemy and offer further salient improvements.
Next - Level 1 Flee Speed: 100% Duration: 2.5s Recharge: 30s

[color=special]Fright[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The first upgrade to [color=dim]Fright[/color] increases your enemies' flee speed by [color=dim]15%[/color].
The [color=dim]duration[/color] of the skill remains the same. The [color=dim]recharge time[/color], however, falls by [color=dim]10%[/color].
Current - Level 1 Flee Speed: 100% Duration: 2.5s Recharge: 30s
Next - Level 2 Flee Speed: 115% Duration: 2.5s Recharge: 27.5s

[color=special]Fright[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
[color=dim]Fright[/color]'s final upgrade dramatically increases the power of the skill. First, you receive modest upgrades in [color=dim]flee speed[/color], [color=dim]duration[/color], and [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
Most notably, however, you also gain a [color=dim]10%[/color] chance of causing an enemy to [color=dim]spontaneously explode[/color] in pure terror.
Current - Level 2 Flee Speed: 115% Duration: 2.5s Recharge: 27.5s
Next - Level 3 Flee Speed: 125% Duration: 3.5s Recharge: 25s 10% chance of explosion

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Fright[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Hologram[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Fright[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Fright[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Fright[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Wall[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]personal-shield[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Shield[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Wall[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Use the [color=dim]Wall[/color] skill to place a temporary wall a step in front of your character. It functions very similarly to a [color=dim]bomb[/color], but it does not explode.
As you upgrade the [color=dim]Wall[/color] skill its [color=dim]duration[/color] will increase. The final upgrade turns the wall into a useful [color=dim]weapon[/color].

[color=special]Wall[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The beginning upgrade to [color=dim]Wall[/color] extends the duration of the device by [color=dim]2 seconds[/color].
Concurrently, the skill's [color=dim]recharge time[/color] falls by [color=dim]2.5 seconds[/color].

[color=special]Wall[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Per usual, the final upgrade to [color=dim]Wall[/color] extends its [color=dim]duration[/color] and drops its [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
More valuably, though, this upgrade applies [color=dim]deadly spikes[/color] to the other side of the wall. The spikes will destroy anything that touches them.
Next - Level 3 Duration: 7s Recharge: 35s Bonus: Spikes

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Wall[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]personal-shield[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Wall[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Wall[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Wall[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Shield[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]wall[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Shield[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Shield[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
[color=dim]Shield[/color] grants you limited invincibility against all damage in the game. Its power will constantly decrease over time, and any [color=dim]damage[/color] you absorb will accelerate that decrease.
Upgrading the [color=dim]Shield[/color] skill will fortify the initial strength of the shield.

[color=special]Shield[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The alpha [color=dim]Shield[/color] upgrade extends the [color=dim]base duration[/color] of the effect by [color=dim]2 seconds[/color] while slightly ebbing the overall [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
In tandem, this upgrade will reduce the damage you absorb by [color=dim]10%[/color], allowing the [color=dim]Shield[/color] to withstand more punishment.
Next - Level 2 Base Duration: 9s Recharge: 42.5s Absorbs: 10%

[color=special]Shield[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Fully upgrading the [color=dim]Shield[/color] skill maximizes the [color=dim]base duration[/color] and takes another [color=dim]2.5 seconds[/color] off of the [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
The Level 3 [color=dim]Shield[/color] also reduces absorbed damage by [color=dim]25%[/color]. The [color=dim]Shield[/color] will thus withstand much more punishment.
Next - Level 3 Base Duration: 10s Recharge: 40s Absorbs: 25%

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Shield[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]wall[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Shield[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Shield[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Shield[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Remote Bomb[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim][/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Bombadier[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Remote Bomb[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color] skill lets you place a [color=dim]bomb[/color] that does not explode until you detonate the bomb.
As you upgrade this skill, you will have the opportunity to place multiple remote bombs before detonating all of them simultaneously.

[color=special]Remote Bomb[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The first [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color] upgrade allows you to place [color=dim]2 remote bombs[/color]. It also lowers the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by a small amount.
After you place one [color=dim]remote bomb[/color], the next [color=dim]regular bomb[/color] you place will automatically become a [color=dim]remote bomb[/co]or]. Activing [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color] after placing the first [color=dim]bomb[/color] will detonate all bombs.

[color=special]Remote Bomb[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
With the last upgrade to [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color], you obtain an even lower [color=dim]recharge time[/color] time, along with a possible [color=dim]3rd remote bomb[/color].
Remember, the [color=dim]first two[/color] regular bombs you place after dropping a [color=dim]remote bomb[/color] will automatically convert into the [color=dim]2nd[/color] and [color=dim]3rd[/color] remote bombs.

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Remote Bomb[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil][/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Remote Bomb[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Mega Bomb[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Remote Bomb[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Bombadier[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Mega Bomb[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
As its name suggests, [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color] supercharges the power of your bomb, increasing the blast radius by one tile in every direction.
To fuel this incredible explosion, you will initially need [color=dim]2 bombs[/color] for every use of the [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color] skill. Future upgrades remove this requirement.
Next - Level 1 Radius: +1 Recharge: 40s Fuel: 2 Bombs

[color=special]Mega Bomb[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The first upgrade to [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color] reduces the fuel requirement to [color=dim]1 bomb[/color].
Likewise, the upgrade reduces the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by [color=dim]2 seconds[/color].
Current - Level 1 Radius: +1 Recharge: 40s Fuel: 2 Bombs
Next - Level 2 Radius: +1 Recharge: 38s Fuel: 1 Bomb

[color=special]Mega Bomb[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
If you brave the final upgrade to [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color], you will destroy entire levels. You will probably blow yourself up, and your framerate might suffer during the ridiculous explosion.
You will need 3 bombs for each use of Level 3 [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color]. Make sure you [color=dim]think this through[/color]!
Current - Level 2 Radius: +1 Recharge: 38s Fuel: 1 Bomb
Next - Level 3 Radius: +3 Recharge: 30s Fuel: 3 Bombs

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Mega Bomb[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Remote Bomb[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Mega Bomb[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Mega Bomb[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Pickpocket[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Invisibility[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Stealth[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Pickpocket[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Using the [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color] skill, you can steal [color=dim]gold[/color] straight out of an [color=dim]enemy[/color]'s hands without trapping him in the ground.
Higher levels of pickpocket increase the [color=dim]effective range[/color] of the skill and, ultimately, attempt to pickpocket [color=dim]townspeople[/color].

[color=special]Pickpocket[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Obtaining the first upgrade to [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color] doubles the skill's range, allowing you to steal gold from enemies approximately halfway across the screen.
With this upgrade, the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] drops by [color=dim]10%[/color].

[color=special]Pickpocket[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The final upgrade to [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color] extends the range of the skill to [color=dim]infinity[/color]. You can steal gold from an enemy at any distance.
Also, the [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color] skill will attempt to steal [color=dim]gold[/color] or [color=dim]items[/color] from friendly people in [color=dim]town areas[/color].
Next - Level 3 Radius: Infinity Recharge: 20s Pickpocket NPCs

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Pickpocket[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Invisibility[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Pickpocket[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Invisibility[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Pickpocket[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Stealth[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Invisibility[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
[color=dim]Invisibility[/color] makes you invisible to enemies for a short span of time. While you remain [color=dim]invisible[/color], the enemies will seek your [color=dim]last known position[/color].
This skill has a very high [color=dim]recharge time[/color]. Higher levels of this skill offer marked reductions to that statistic.

[color=special]Invisibility[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The first upgrade to [color=dim]Invisibility[/color] extends the duration of the effect by [color=dim]0.5 seconds[/color].
In addition, the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] on the skill drops by [color=dim]10 seconds[/color] with this upgrade.

[color=special]Invisibility[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The highest upgrade for [color=dim]Invisibility[/color] adds [color=dim]0.5 seconds[/color] to the overall duration of the skill and reduces the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by another [color=dim]10 seconds[/color].
Additionally, any time you spend [color=dim]standing still[/color] while [color=dim]invisible[/color] will only expend [color=dim]50%[/color] of the [color=dim]timer[/color], allowing you to milk extra time out of the skill.
Next - Level 3 Duration: 4s Recharge Time: 50s 50% Standstill Bonus

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Invisibility[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Pickpocket[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Invisibility[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Invisibility[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Invisibility[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Jackhammer[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim][/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Mining Laser[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Jackhammer[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The [color=dim]Jackhammer[/color] skill allows you to dig [color=dim]multiple tiles[/color] into the ground with a single blast of your mining laser.
Future upgrades to this skill will increase the [color=dim]depth[/color] of each dig, among other simple improvements.

[color=special]Jackhammer[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
[color=dim]Jackhammer[/color]'s opening upgrade increases the depth of each dig by [color=dim]one tile[/color].
As an added bonus, the skill's [color=dim]recharge time[/color] decreases by [color=dim]5 seconds[/color].

[color=special]Jackhammer[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The final upgrade for the [color=dim]Jackhammer[/color] skill substantially reduces the overall [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
Furthermore, each tile you dig with this skill will remain unfilled for [color=dim]20%[/color] longer.
Next - Level 3 Dig depth: 3 Recharge: 15s Digs last 20% longer

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Jackhammer[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil][/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Jackhammer[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Jackhammer[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Jackhammer[/color] to its highest possible level.

[color=special]Earth Mover[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: n/a[/color]
After unlocking the [color=dim]Jackhammer[/color] skill, you lost access to this branch of the [color=dim]Mining Laser[/color] skill tree.

[color=special]Earth Mover[/color] (Level 1) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
Using [color=dim]Earthmover[/color] gives you the power to dig [color=dim]multiple tiles[/color] ahead of you with one blast of your mining laser.
Further upgrades to [color=dim]Earthmover[/color] will increase the [color=dim]distance[/color] of each dig while offering other small perks.

[color=special]Earth Mover[/color] (Level 2) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
The beginning upgrade to [color=dim]Earthmover[/color] extends the range of the dig by an extra [color=dim]one tile[/color].
In conjunction, this upgrade reduces the [color=dim]recharge time[/color] by [color=dim]5 seconds[/color].

[color=special]Earth Mover[/color] (Level 3) [color=dim]Required Character Level: [/color]#
[color=dim]Earthmover[/color]'s ultimate upgrade greatly reduces the skill's total [color=dim]recharge time[/color].
As well, each tile you dig with [color=dim]Earthmover[/color] will remain unfilled for [color=dim]20%[/color] longer.
Next - Level 3 Dig distance: 3 Recharge: 15s Digs last 20% longer

Note:
[color=dim]By unlocking[/color] [color=special]Earth Mover[/color][color=dim], you will lose access to the[/color] [color=evil]Jackhammer[/color] [color=dim]ability.[/color]
You have already unlocked [color=dim]Earth Mover[/color]; as a result, you cannot unlock [color=evil]Earth Mover[/color].
You must reach [color=dim]Character Level 5[/color] before you can unlock this skill.
You do not have a [color=dim]skill point[/color] available to spend.
You have fully upgraded [color=dim]Earth Mover[/color] to its highest possible level.
